channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump re-enacts policy banning aid to groups abroad that discuss or provide abortions
item.description: The Mexico City Policy cuts off U.S. aid to health groups in other countries that offer abortion services or counseling. As in 2021, Trump has reinstated this policy, which was deactivated by Biden.
item.content:encoded:
The Mexico City Policy cuts off U.S. aid to health groups in other countries that offer abortion services or counseling. As in 2021, Trump has reinstated this policy, which was deactivated by Biden.

(Image credit: Sam Reinders for NPR)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Carlson

item.title: U.S. puts virtually all foreign aid on 90-day hold, issues 'stop-work' order
item.description: Following Trump's Monday freeze on foreign aid, a subsequent memo calls for for a stop-work order for current grants and contracts.
item.content:encoded:
Following Trump's Monday freeze on foreign aid, a subsequent memo calls for for a stop-work order for current grants and contracts.

(Image credit: Orlando Sierra/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Fatma Tanis

item.title: Arrest warrant proposed for Taliban leaders for gender-based crimes
item.description: The International Criminal Court, a U.N. agency, has to approve the warrants. They've been condemned by the Taliban and welcomed by Afghan women and their advocates — with some reservations.
item.content:encoded:
The International Criminal Court, a U.N. agency, has to approve the warrants. They've been condemned by the Taliban and welcomed by Afghan women and their advocates — with some reservations.

(Image credit: Wakil Kohsar/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Ruchi Kumar

item.title: UnitedHealthcare names new CEO after Brian Thompson's killing
item.description: The largest U.S. insurer promoted company executive Tim Noel to replace Thompson, whose death sparked a national outcry over the health care industry.
item.content:encoded:
The largest U.S. insurer promoted company executive Tim Noel to replace Thompson, whose death sparked a national outcry over the health care industry.

(Image credit: Stephen Maturen/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Maria Aspan

item.title: Her brother was supposed to enter the U.S. as a refugee. That's on hold now.
item.description: This week the Trump administration suspended the country's refugee resettlement program, leaving thousands of people – who had been cleared and scheduled to come to the U.S. – in a limbo.
item.content:encoded: This week the Trump administration suspended the country's refugee resettlement program, leaving thousands of people – who had been cleared and scheduled to come to the U.S. – in a limbo.
item.dc:creator: Alejandra Marquez Janse

item.title: Trump ends Fauci's security detail, says he'd feel no responsibility if he was harmed
item.description: Fauci is the latest in a string of former Trump aides-turned-critics to see their federal protection canceled.
item.content:encoded:
Fauci is the latest in a string of former Trump aides-turned-critics to see their federal protection canceled.

(Image credit: Cliff Owen)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: French woman who refused sex with husband not to blame for divorce, rights court says
item.description: Europe's top human rights court ruled the woman's right to respect for private and family life had been violated when French courts found her solely at fault for her divorce because she withheld sex.
item.content:encoded:
Europe's top human rights court ruled the woman's right to respect for private and family life had been violated when French courts found her solely at fault for her divorce because she withheld sex.

(Image credit: Frederick Florin)
item.dc:creator: Manuela López Restrepo

item.title: Photos: See the pandas' official return to the National Zoo
item.description: Giant pandas Bao Li and Qing Bao are out of quarantine and in the spotlight after a three-month wait and 8,000 mile trip from China.
item.content:encoded:
Giant pandas Bao Li and Qing Bao are out of quarantine and in the spotlight after a three-month wait and 8,000 mile trip from China.

(Image credit: Tyrone Turner)
item.dc:creator: Amy Held

item.title: Trump officials empower DHS to expel migrants allowed under 2 Biden programs
item.description: Immigration officials now have permission to quickly expel migrants temporarily admitted via the CBP One App and a separate program for certain people fleeing Cuba, Haiti, Nicaragua and Venezuela.
item.content:encoded:
Immigration officials now have permission to quickly expel migrants temporarily admitted via the CBP One App and a separate program for certain people fleeing Cuba, Haiti, Nicaragua and Venezuela.

(Image credit: Gilles Clarenne)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Trump wants to label drug cartels terrorist organizations. Here's what that means in practice
item.description: The full implications of designating the cartels as terrorist organizations will depend, in large part, to how the administration follows through.
item.content:encoded:
The full implications of designating the cartels as terrorist organizations will depend, in large part, to how the administration follows through.

(Image credit: Jim Watson)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas
